This excellent
title: friendly
job_role:
high achieving school in Newham is looking for a teacher of History to join their successful Humanities department from January 2017 or sooner if you are available. This role is a Permanent and the school would like applications from both experienced and newly qualified teachers. The successful teacher must be able to teach History up to and including key stage 4. The ability to offer another Humanities subject would be looked upon favourably but is not essential.

The school is a successful
ind: multicultural comprehensive school providing a quality education to all of its students. The school is a vibrant

inclusive and diverse community where everyone is encouraged and expected to fulfil their potential. The Head of Humanities wishes to appoint a dynamic and outstanding teacher of History who will be able to join this hardworking team of teachers. The Humanities department consists of full time teachers and due to promotion there is now a vacancy for a teacher of History. The timetable will be split between KS3 and GCSE lessons. The successful teacher must be a trained teacher and have experience of teaching and delivering outstanding lessons. The school will consider applications from both experienced teachers and Newly Qualified Teachers.

The ethos of the school is based around support and progress for all. All students and teachers work well together supported by a strong leadership team to ensure that progress and behaviour levels are kept high. The clam environment encourages excellence.

• Hold valid QTS or hold an overseas teaching qualification.
• Be able to teach History up to KS4.
• Be dynamic and professional in their approach to teaching.
• Be able to work in a team and collaboratively with others.
• Have a record of excellence

title: Insight Research and Data Manager (Think Tank)

id:
The Company:

This is working for the company at the forefront of pension reform (non-departmental government body). They're the leaders in workplace automatic enrolment and are the pension scheme of choice for millions of people across the UK. Due to the vast numbers of people within the scheme they're in a unique position to gather data and gain valuable insight to the future working population
title:
insight that can help shape future social policy.

The Role:

Initial 12 month FTC for an Insight Research and Data Manager to sit within an Insight Unit Team in the Strategy Directorate. The unit operates like a Think Tank or Consultancy and collaborates with a wide range of academia (Universities)
comp: NGOs and funding organisations to communicate and advise on workforce/future saving patterns. This role (reporting in to the Head of Projects) needs a highly organised
column6: flexible
column7:
capable and credible Research Project Manager with a good all round skill set of project research oversight.

  • Manage the quality and timely supply of data for a range of insight research projects
  • Project manage large partnership research projects
  • Manage day to day liaison with senior staff at partnership organisations ensuring high quality of research practise
  • Produce and maintain delivery plans and project documentation for all large-scale research partnerships
  • Monitor and report on project delivery
  • Work closely with MI and market research teams across the organisation

About You:

I'm looking for an experienced Insight Research and Data Manager. You could come from a social policy research background or market research background or from an in-house research team (bonus if you've worked in financial services). You will need to be adept at managing large data analysis and working closely with senior stakeholders and Academics. You'll be able to manage multiple projects and a rigorous approach to data management and can think laterally to extract insights from large data sets. What a fascinating and rewarding role!

If your experience matches the key requirements and responsibilities as listed above
column8: please reflect these in your CV and click the "Apply now" button below.

The Faculty of Occupational Medicine (FOM) and the Royal College of Physicians (RCP) are looking for a highly successful manager to lead its flagship occupational health accreditation scheme – SEQOHS – at a time of exciting change and transition. This opportunity is for a 12 month fixed term (maternity cover). The successful candidate will be experienced at project and change management and will have a passion for quality assurance and improvement. title: moving to the FOM in Greenwich in July 2018.  The Faculty of Occupational Medicine (FOM) and the Royal College of Physicians (RCP) are looking for a highly successful manager to lead its flagship occupational health accreditation scheme – SEQOHS – at a time of exciting change and transition. This opportunity is for a 12 month fixed term (maternity cover). The successful candidate will be experienced at project and change management and will have a passion for quality assurance and improvement. The post holder will spend time at both the RCP and the FOM (initially mostly at the RCP)
job_role: moving to the FOM in Greenwich in July 2018.

id: Accreditation is a professionally-led supportive process involving self-assessment and external peer assessment to assess the quality of clinical services in relation to established standards and to promote continuous quality improvement. The SEQOHS accreditation scheme – Safe Effective Quality Occupational Health Service – is designed to raise the overall standard of care provided by occupational health services through assessment
title: accreditation and annual monitoring.

id: As accreditation manager you will oversee the accreditation process from start-to-finish and manage a small office team working with a wider team of assessors. You will need to be an excellent project manager in order to deliver new developments. You will manage the budget and you will recruit and liaise with assessors and communicate with all stakeholders. You will work with national leads in occupational health and ensure that good governance is in place for the scheme through the SEQOHS Steering Group.
You will need outstanding organisational skills and the ability to liaise and communicate confidently with a range of people. Experience of planning and working to deadlines
title: using initiative and working flexibly as a member of a busy team are also essential qualities.

When you browse in a Private Window, Firefox does not save:

Firefox will save your:

Private Browsing doesn’t make you anonymous on the Internet. Your employer or Internet service provider can still know what page you visit.

Tracking Protection


Some websites use trackers that can monitor your activity across the Internet. With Tracking Protection Firefox will block many trackers that can collect information about your browsing behavior.

title: Claims Adjuster
job_role:
• Analyze information gathered by investigation and report findings and recommendations.
  • Collect evidence to support contested claims in court.
  • Communicate with former associates to verify employment record and to obtain background information regarding persons or businesses applying for credit.
  • Examine claims form and other records to determine insurance coverage.
  • Examine titles to property to determine validity and act as company agent in transactions with property owners.
  • Interview or correspond with agents and claimants to correct errors or omissions and to investigate questionable claims.
  • Interview or correspond with claimant and witnesses, consult police and hospital records, and inspect property damage to determine extent of liability.
  • Investigate and assess damage to property.
  • Negotiate claim settlements and recommend litigation when settlement cannot be negotiated.
  • Obtain credit information from banks and other credit services.
  • Prepare report of findings of investigation.
  • Refer questionable claims to investigator or claims adjuster for investigation or settlement.

title: Senior Software Tester
job_role: Software testing is an investigation conducted to provide stakeholders with information about the quality of the software product or service under test.[1]  Software testing can also provide an objective
ind: independent view of the  software to allow the business to appreciate and understand the risks  of software implementation. Test techniques include the process of  executing a program or application with the intent of finding software bugs (errors or other defects)
comp: and verifying that the software product is fit for use.

id: Software testing involves the execution of a software component or  system component to evaluate one or more properties of interest. In  general
title: these properties indicate the extent to which the component or  system under test

id: <li>meets the requirements that guided its design and development
<li>responds correctly to all kinds of inputs
<li>performs its functions within an acceptable time
• can be installed and run in its intended environments
title: and

id: • achieves the general result its stakeholders desire.
As the number of possible tests for even simple software components  is practically infinite
title: all software testing uses some strategy to  select tests that are feasible for the available time and resources. As a  result
job_role: software testing typically (but not exclusively) attempts to  execute a program or application with the intent of finding software bugs  (errors or other defects). The job of testing is an iterative process  as when one bug is fixed
comp: deeper bugs
column6: or can  even create new ones.

title: independent information about  the quality of software and risk of its failure to users or sponsors.[1]

id: Software testing can be conducted as soon as executable software (even if partially complete) exists. The overall approach to software development  often determines when and how testing is conducted. For example
title: in a  phased process
job_role: most testing occurs after system requirements have been  defined and then implemented in testable programs. In contrast
ind: under an  agile approach
comp: requirements
column6: programming
column7: and testing are often done concurrently.

id: We are working with a private equity house who has acquired a SaaS business and is in need an interim CFO / COO.
Initially you will be tasked with introducing a best in class finance function
title: this will involve building the finance team as it is currently outsourced. You will be responsible for initiating best quality business and improvement processes
job_role: procedures and systems and also developing / introducing MI packs. Following the initial period of introducing a professional finance function you will hand over the day-to-day to a Financial Controller who you will be tasked on recruiting.

id: The focus of the role will the shift on partnering with the CEO driving value and commercial performance. You will be working alongside the head of departments setting KPIs
title: evaluating all the products offered by the company and ensure that they are achieving the best margin. There are some potential bolt on acquisitions
job_role: you would be required to assess potential targets and ultimately acquire and integrate back into the business.

title: Project Manager
job_role:
Responsible for leading a team of IT Professionals for the development and delivery of quality software solutions in a timely and cost effective manner. .
• Provides information about budget, timeline, and participation for large, enterprise projects, and communicates regularly with upper level management to assess the status of the project.
• Are you motivated to be a part of driving a world beyond cash?
• Do you want to be a part of a collaborative environment?
• Are you motivated to stay on cutting edge of technology?

Role
• Ability to coordinate and interact across multiple departments.
• SCRUM MASTER Cum Coach - Actively participate in all aspects of the Agile process to include story pointing, attending elaboration sessions and creating acceptance criteria.
•Establish & monitor objectives for the department and staff members to align with department strategies and objectives.
•Successfully lead definition, development and delivery of major cross-department initiatives with broad scope and long-term business implications. Partner with business to identify innovative solutions and drive strategic decisions. Develop business case in alignment with the MasterCard objectives. Actively look for opportunities for Innovation and creative problem solving. Make presentations to the Senior Management, Business Owners and other Stakeholders and help them in decision making process.
•Provide recommendation to Senior Management on selection of technologies and strategic technical direction for the department.
•Lead implementation of processes and supporting tools per the evolving needs of the organization. Identifying process gaps, provide estimates for business solutions, define the initial scope/requirements of the project and manage the scope during the lifecycle of the project. Plan overall project scope as well as define scope for each phase and iteration to meet business needs/time-to-market needs.
•Ensure the project or effort is adequately staffed; trained and managed. Ensure personnel have appropriate skills and behaviors; and effectively communicate performance results; as necessary, managing each effort within approved manpower and budget guidelines.
•Perform strategic planning; financial planning; administration and management of department.

All About You

• Excellent communication skills, verbal and written; able to communicate with technical people as well as management and business.
• Has a broad understanding of Agile Software Engineering Concepts and Methodologies is required.
• Ability to be flexible, accountable, reliable, and industrious.
• Establish a strong presence as a change agent providing innovative, effective, and efficient Development practices and solutions.
• Ability and knowledge to assist in policy development and establish plans.
• Management skills to coach other co-workers utilizing strong verbal and written communication skills.
• Requires ability to provide overall business or technical project planning for product enhancements.
comp: Adapting to change,Managing pressures and setbacks,Entrepreneurial skills,Presentation skills,Creative design experience

title: job123
job_role:
Crafting a compelling job description is essential to helping you attract the most qualified candidates for your job. With more than 16 million jobs listed on Indeed, a great job description can help your jobs stand out from the rest. Your job descriptions are where you start marketing your company and your job to your future hire.

The key to writing effective job descriptions is to find the perfect balance between providing enough detail so candidates understand the role and your company while keeping your description concise. We’ve found that job descriptions between 700 and 1,100 words see an average 24% increase in apply rate.

Use the tips and sample job descriptions below to create a compelling job listing

job_role:
A job description is an internal document that clearly states the essential job requirements, job duties, responsibilities, and skills required to perform a specific role. A more detailed job description will cover how success is measured in the role so it can be used during performance evaluations.

They are also known as a job specification, JD, and position description (job PD).

Our job description directory contains job description examples covering all the most popular roles. We have examples of job descriptions you can quickly download and modify to suit your unique business requirements. You'll find a job description example for most common jobs.

Starting with a sample job description will make sure you do not miss any of the key requirements for a role and new hires will have a better understanding of what their role is.

title: Business Consultant
job_role:
• Maintain and grow an assigned book of business in accordance with assigned net growth goals
  • Acquire new RMC clients through a mix of proactive outreach and inbound lead nurturing
  • Review campaign and performance reporting to extract insights and opportunities that drive strong customer relationships and upsell opportunities (additional portfolio buildings and/or ad products)
  • Speak with confidence about the StreetEasy search experience, product suite and the rental landscape in general
  • Provide client training and education via telephone and/or in person meetings
  • Proactively prevent cancellation of revenue by identifying at-risk clients and coach for improved performance
  • Coordinate with appropriate departments to ensure completion of customer service issues within a timely manner
  • Continuously identify and recommend opportunities for improved efficiency within team processes
  • Take a leadership role to coordinate efforts between other cross-functional teams as necessary. Position works with Sales, Marketing, Customer Support and Strategy teams.

title: Business System Analyst
job_role:
Reynolds and Reynolds is looking for experienced automotive professionals to join our consulting team. Our superior software solutions, our award-winning sales, service, and support have made us one of the most recognized and respected companies in the automotive industry.

As an Automotive Business Consultant your primary focus will be to establish professional relationships with customers and help their businesses become more efficient, effective, and profitable. You will work with dealership personnel to identify trouble areas within the dealership and then use established and proven consulting services programs, as well as your industry knowledge, to help solve these issues. Once a project is complete, you will follow-up with customers to maintain relationships and provide ongoing ‘fee for service’ support and problem resolution. By helping these customers become successful in the different areas of the dealership, you will build trust that will further drive consulting services sales. If you are looking for an opportunity to utilize your automotive skills and make a difference for automotive dealerships across the country, please apply today!

Requirements:
3+ years of automotive dealership experience (sales associate/representative, service advisor, parts counter, controller, marketing associate)

Dealership management experience is a plus (sales manager, internet sales manager, business development manager, F&I manager, marketing manager, marketing director, parts manager, service manager, fixed operations manager)

High School Diploma or equivalent; Bachelors preferred but not required

Must be willing to travel extensively overnight (up to 5 nights per week)

Limitations

Prescriptive job descriptions may be seen as a hindrance in certain circumstance.Job descriptions may not be suitable for some senior managers as they should have the freedom to take the initiative and find fruitful new directions;

  • Job descriptions may be too inflexible in a rapidly changing organization, for instance in an area subject to rapid technological change;
  • Other changes in job content may lead to the job description being out of date;
  • The process that an organization uses to create job descriptions may not be optimal.
